column1: 18$Schizophrenia$9/8/2012 2:12:40 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$5$I have been taking Fanapt for a week and half.  The side effects at first were horrible; dizziness
column7: etc.  I was switching from Latuda to the Fanapt and there was a little while when I was first on it that my symptoms came back (hallucinations and delusions mostly).  Now I'm to the point where I could handle the side effects I still have (dry eyes
column9: congestion) except that my legs keep swelling pretty big.  I'm using Flonase for the congestion
column10: which really helps.  My symptoms are under control but I have a feeling that when I see my psychiatrist they will want me to switch to something else.

60$Schizophrenia$4/25/2010 5:27:55 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  (Patient) $1$1$5$Don't take this drug unless you hvae plenty of muscle relaxers and can sit or lay down all day. This medicine has just turned me into according to my family when they see me, it looks like you are drunk. This medicine has totally messed with my sleep cycle in thatI am awake during the night and day time with very little sleep. If your body is sensitive to EPS (extrapyramidal syndrome) then please do not take this drug, it only makes it worse. And as for the whole bit about about being able to think clearer, don't believe it, it just made me more confused and I also feel very slow with my speech and verbal responses.
